___^(?!generic$).*.description: This part should take care of all the products. Note that products can have any names

___standards.name: Standards and Requirements
___standards.description: A list of standards that applies to the printed circuit board industry

___inner_packaging.name: Inner Packaging
___inner_packaging.description: This describes how boards are packed together to be shipped. Part of IPC 1601 (4.2.2)

items.name: Dielectric
items.description: A list of one of more materials used as dielectric. Every material listed here must have be listed in the materials section with the name of the material as the key. This element is a list and can contain several items

___precedence_general.name: Precedence of supplied files
___precedence_general.description: If several sources of information are present within one request, such as both ODB++ and Gerbers, which is preferred.

___precedence_production_files.name: Precedence of production files
___precedence_production_files.description: If several production files are present within one request, such as both ODB++ and Gerbers, which is preferred.

___testing.name: Testing
___testing.description: The tests that are to be performed

___hard_gold_edge_connectors.name: Hard Gold Edge Connectors
___hard_gold_edge_connectors.description: Edge connectors made with hard gold

items.name: Holes
items.description: One for each holes process, or at least one that sums up the minimum requirements

___stackup.name: Stackup
___stackup.description: The stackup of the board. Can also include the stackup itself in the "specified" element.

___specified.description: The container where the elements describing the stackup should be placed. All elements under object must contain the "layer_order" tags to set the order of the layer. They should also contain the "layer_name" tag to set the descriptive name of the layer

items.aliases: Surfacefinish, Surface finish, Coating, finalfinish, Solderable finish, Solderable coating
items.name: Final Finish
items.description: A list of final finishes, can be more than one. E.g. selective finish ENIG and OSP.

___precedence_drawings.name: Precedence of drawings
___precedence_drawings.description: If several drawings are present within one request, which is preferred if a conflict is found.

___legend.name: Legend
___legend.description: The legend to be used on the board

___allowed_modifications.name: Allowed Modifications
___allowed_modifications.description: Changes/fabrication decisions that are allowed to make to the files provided.

___peelable_mask.aliases: peelable solder mask, strippable mask, blue-mask
___peelable_mask.name: Peelable mask
___peelable_mask.description: Peelable solder mask that are removed after processing

___board.name: Board
___board.description: The physical description of the board

items.aliases: solder mask, sm, solder resist, green mask
items.name: Soldermask
items.description: A list of final soldermasks, can be more than one

___via_protection.name: Via Protection
___via_protection.description: The via/hole protection according to IPC 4761

___additional_requirements.name: Additional Requirements
___additional_requirements.description: This section is for all requirements that still has not been adapted to the standard or needs to be stated as a comment. It allows you to specify custom elements that should be considered as part of the specification. You specify the value here and then need to create a separate element for it in the custom -> additional section. Multiple elements allowed - to be added as a list.

___kapton_tape.name: Kapton tape
___kapton_tape.description: Kapton (polyimide) tape suitable for fixing, masking and sealing

___country_of_origin.name: Country of Origin
___country_of_origin.description: Country of Origin is the country where the Printed Circuit Board is manufactured.

___generic.description: this should validate any element under generic to be valid

___capabilities.description: This part should take care of all the products. Note that products can have any name

___value.description: If type is hex, the value needs to be a "#" + 6 hexadecimals (e.g. "#FFFFFF"). for "rgb" the format is "rgb(0, 255, 255)", for "cmyk" the format is "cmyk(100%, 0%, 0%, 0%)". The name is just a string.

___updated.description: The timestamp of the last update of the file, in RFC 3339 date-time format

___company.description: The company who owns the information in the file

___version.description: The name of the project included in the file

___person.description: The person responsible for the information in the file

___project.description: The name of the project included in the file

___created.description: The timestamp of the creation of the file, in RFC 3339 date-time format

___editor_software.description: The software that has generated the file

___precedence_general.name: Precedence of supplied files
___precedence_general.description: If several sources of information are present within one request, such as both ODB++ and Gerbers, which is preferred.

___precedence_production_files.name: Precedence of production files
___precedence_production_files.description: If several production files are present within one request, such as both ODB++ and Gerbers, which is preferred.

___precedence_drawings.name: Precedence of drawings
___precedence_drawings.description: If several drawings are present within one request, which is preferred if a conflict is found.

___precedence_general.name: Precedence of supplied files
___precedence_general.description: If several sources of information are present within one request, such as both ODB++ and Gerbers, which is preferred.

___precedence_production_files.name: Precedence of production files
___precedence_production_files.description: If several production files are present within one request, such as both ODB++ and Gerbers, which is preferred.

___precedence_drawings.name: Precedence of drawings
___precedence_drawings.description: If several drawings are present within one request, which is preferred if a conflict is found.
